business.headline: Sensex opens 300 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Eternal down 3%Sensex opens 300 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Eternal down 3%

ICICI Prudential IPO closes today: Should you bid as GMP crosses 10% gain?ICICI Prudential AMC IPO opened for bidding on December 12, 2025, and will close today, December 16, 2025. Share allotment is expected to be finalised on December 17, while listing on BSE and NSE is scheduled for December 19, 2025.

WPI inflation stays negative in November despite food price uptickGovernment data released on Monday showed Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation at (-) 0.32% in November, compared with (-) 1.21% in October.
India's exports jump 19% in November, trade deficit hits 5-month lowThe US remained India's largest export destination from April to November 2025, despite the imposition of a 50% tariff.

Sensex, Nifty rebound to end marginally lower as FII outflow troubles marketThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 54.30 points to close at 85,213.36, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.65 points to end at 26,027.30.

SBI reduces lending rates, EMIs likely to drop: Check new home loan ratesWith several major banks already passing on the benefit, SBI's move will directly help customers whose loans are linked to different lending benchmarks.

Gold and silver at record highs. Should investors buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are trading near record highs after a powerful rally this year. With both metals delivering strong returns, many investors are now wondering whether it still makes sense to buy or wait for a correction.

December 15 advance tax deadline is here: Who must pay and what happens if you don'tThe third advance tax instalment is due today, December 15. For many taxpayers, missing this deadline could mean mandatory interest and a larger payment at the time of filing returns.

Claimed tax refunds using fake donations? Here's what income tax department is doingIf you claimed tax benefits by showing donations that were never made, the Income Tax Department may already be watching. Authorities have launched a fresh drive to identify and correct such false claims.

4-day work week under new labour codes? Here's what Labour Ministry clarifiedOn November 21, 2025, the government replaced 29 old labour laws with four new Labour Codes and can Indians really work only four days a week and still get paid for a full week?

Hindustan Zinc shares may climb to Rs 660. Here's why Jefferies is bullishAccording to brokerage firm Jefferies, the Rs 660 target price suggests a potential upside of around 22%, including a dividend yield of about 4%.
Sensex opens 200 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; NTPC down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 394.84 points to 84,872.82, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 129.75 points to 25,917.20 as of 9:29 am.

Want to save tax? Here's how gifting mutual funds can help you with itA lesser-known method is gaining attention, gifting mutual fund units to relatives to legally reduce, or in some cases completely avoid, tax on capital gains.

Park Medi World IPO: Check allotment status as GMP falls to its lowestPark Medi World IPO closed with an overall subscription of 8.52 times, showing steady demand across categories even as premium expectations cooled.

New labour codes: Will variable pay change your salary, PF and gratuity?Will your take-home salary change under the new labour codes, and what will higher variable pay mean for your PF and gratuity in the long run? Let's understand.

Goa fire tragedy: From compensation to insurance, what victims can claimThe Uphaar cinema fire in Delhi, the Kumbakonam school blaze, the Mumbai Kamala Mills fire, the Surat coaching centre tragedy, each incident left behind not just casualties, but families pushed into years of legal battles simply to secure basic compensation.

Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $40 million to 2 women in talc powder caseThe verdict comes as the company faces tens of thousands of similar lawsuits nationwide and after its latest attempt to resolve the litigation through bankruptcy was rejected by US courts.

How is young India really spending money? Hint: It's not gadgets and clothesYoung Indians' spending habits are shifting quickly, and it's no longer about gadgets or new outfits. Here's a closer look at where their money is actually going.

Cabinet clears 100% FDI in insurance: What the new bill means for the sectorThe government says the changes are designed to offer stronger protection to policyholders and bring more players into the market. This could lead to better products, faster claim settlements, and improved customer service.

Aroon Purie rings NSE bell, says it's for next chapter of India, India Today GroupIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie on Friday rang the closing bell at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) to mark the Group's 50-year journey and said it was for the next chapter of India and the India Today Group.

entertainment.headline: 19 films barred from Kerala film festival, including Palestine and Spanish titles The Union Information and Broadcasting Ministry denied permission for the screening of 19 films at the 2025 International Film Festival of Kerala, including several on Palestine and the Spanish film Beef, prompting public protests and criticism from organisers.

Don't play with our emotions: Shraddha Kapoor pushes for early Dhurandhar sequel Dhurandhar continues its phenomenal box-office run, crossing Rs 500 crore worldwide, while winning praise from celebrities, including Shraddha Kapoor, who urged director Aditya Dhar to prepone the sequel.

Insensitive: Actor Bhagyalakshmi slams Mohanlal for sharing Dileep film poster Dubbing artist and actor Bhagyalakshmi called Mohanlal "insensitive" and "thoughtless" for endorsing Dileep's new film, Bha Bha Ba, following his acquittal in the 2017 Malayalam actor assault case, raising questions about industry solidarity with survivors.

AP Dhillon name-drops Mohammad Siraj during concert, fans go wild Punjabi singer AP Dhillon's recent Pune concert was marked by electrifying performances, special guest appearances and a moment that paid tribute to cricketer Mohammed Siraj.

Rob Reiner, wife Michele murder timeline: All that happened so far Director-actor Rob Reiner and Michele Reiner were found dead from stab wounds in their Los Angeles home on Sunday. Their son, Nick Reiner, was taken into custody as the LAPD continues to investigate the case.

Dhurandhar vs Animal: Gore, machismo and two polarising blockbusters What connects Dhurandhar and Animal beyond their violence and box office numbers? Here's an exploration of why audiences can't stop talking about them, even when they disagree.

Mariah Carey to headline Milano Cortina 2026 winter olympics opening ceremony Organisers have announced that Mariah Carey will headline the opening ceremony of the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milan and Cortina, marking her as the first major international performer announced for the event. The ceremony is scheduled for February 6, 2026, at the Milano San Siro Olympic Stadium.

General Hospital star Anthony Geary dies at 78 after surgery complications Anthony Geary, best known for portraying Luke Spencer on General Hospital, has died aged 78. His decades-long career and iconic on-screen partnership with Genie Francis as Laura cemented his legacy in daytime television history.

Noah Schnapp feels honoured to be godfather to Millie Bobby Brown's daughter Millie Bobby Brown and her husband Jake Bongiovi recently welcomed a daughter via adoption, with Brown's long-time friend and Stranger Things co-star Noah Schnapp named as godfather.

Rob Reiner, son Nick fought at Conan O'Brien party hours before deaths: Report Rob Reiner and his wife Michele, were discovered dead in their Los Angeles residence on December 14. Their son, Nick Reiner, has been arrested and charged with murder, following a reported altercation between father and son at a holiday party hosted by Conan O'Brien the previous evening.

Mohanlal's Vrusshabha trailer to launch in Kochi on December 16 The trailer of Mohanlal's upcoming film Vrusshabha is set to release in Kochi on December 16. The film is slated to release in theatres on December 25.

Brand Akshaye has finally opened eyes: Ameesha Patel's post amid Dhurandhar success Actor Akshaye Khanna's role in Aditya Dhar's espionage thriller Dhurandhar continues to earn him widespread recognition, with Ameesha Patel praising his contributions and acknowledging his renewed popularity.

Rishab Shetty not okay with people mimicking Daivas: I feel uncomfortable Actor Rishab Shetty expressed unease regarding the on-stage mimicking of Daiva rituals, following criticism directed at Ranveer Singh's performance during the International Film Festival of India in Goa earlier this month. Singh issued an apology after his actions sparked debate about cultural sensitivity in cinematic representations.

Simon Cowell's new boyband's BTS shade invokes ragebait debate A member of Simon Cowell's pre-debut boy group, December 10, sparked massive backlash by calling BTS "terrible" and boasting their own group's future success. The viral moment is being debated as "ragebait," designed to provoke ARMY engagement for quick online visibility.

Stephen Colbert questions Paramount's Warner Bros bid over The Late Show axing Stephen Colbert questioned the cancellation of his show for financial reasons when parent company Paramount bid $108 billion for Warner Bros. He joked the bid, partly funded by Middle Eastern wealth funds, meant the company could afford to "uncancel one of their best shows."

De Do Oscar: Smriti Irani praises Akshaye Khanna's Dhurandhar performance Amid Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar success, actor-politician Smriti Irani praised Akshaye Khanna's role as Rehman Dakait in the film.

My Hero Academia wraps up emotionally as Deku and friends say until next time The popular anime series, My Hero Academia came to a close with its latest episode marking the end of a successful run spread across nine years and 181 episodes including OVA's, split into eight seasons.

Rob Reiner's son Nick arrested in parents' deaths: Reports Hollywood director-actor Rob Reiner and Michele Singer's son, Nick, was arrested in parents' deaths. Reportedly, he is currently in the custody of the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department, with bail set at USD 4 million.

Kriti Sanon responds to criticism of her Tere Ishk Mein's toxic character Actor Kriti Sanon recently spoke about the response to her latest film, Tere Ishk Mein, reacting to comments from audiences who have described her character Mukti as 'toxic' and shared negative sentiments toward the film's portrayal of relationships.

general news.headline: Luthra brothers, accused in Goa nightclub fire that killed 25, board flight to India from ThailandLuthra brothers, accused in Goa nightclub fire that killed 25, board flight to India from Thailand

Buses and cars collide amid dense fog on Delhi-Agra Expressway, 4 deadA tragic multi-vehicle collision in dense fog on the Delhi-Agra Expressway has claimed four lives and injured around 25 others. Rescue operations are ongoing as authorities investigate the cause of the deadly pile-up.

Jailed Imran Khan, gave lifetime immunity to Asim Munir: India shreds Pak at UNIndia strongly criticised Pakistan at the United Nations Security Council, linking Islamabad's internal political crisis with its history of cross-border terrorism. The Indian envoy also called for urgent reforms in the UNSC to address modern global challenges.

IPL 2026 auction has a new rule and it's stirring a debateIPL Auction: The Indian Premier League mini-auction is set to take place in Abu Dhabi. Ahead of the event, a major rule change has sparked widespread debate among fans, with many questioning whether the new regulation makes any sense at all.

Tamilakam drew its own map: Texts, Terrain and Dravida TurnAryāvart's ancient texts have all ushered us towards the reaches of Dhakṣiṇapatha. They traced the routes that led to the sun-baked expanses of Dravida that extended over land, sea, and even the islands abutting its lower flank. These texts saw the South as a tantalising terminus, a zone of exploration and 'discovery', an uncharted wild periphery.

Video: Nitish Kumar pulls woman's hijab at event, Congress slams 'despicable act'A video showed Nitish Kumar pulling down a doctor's hijab after handing over an appointment letter to her at a Patna event. The video, which is going viral on social media, has sparked widespread outrage.

Smog relief for Delhi, but AQI severe in several areas, flights remain affectedDelhi-NCR experienced a slight improvement in air quality and visibility on Tuesday, a day after the city reeled under heavy smog, with the AQI reaching hazardous levels.

Kabaddi player shot dead during match; attackers opened fire while asking for selfieA kabaddi player was shot dead by bike-borne assailants during a tournament in Mohali. The victim was attacked when he was approached by the attackers on the pretext of taking a selfie. The Bambiha gang claimed responsibility for the shooting.

Sai Jadhav breaks 93-year record at Indian Military Academy, becomes first woman officerKolhapur's Sai Jadhav has become the first woman officer to pass out from the Indian Military Academy, the prestigious armed forces institution. Her milestone has broken a 93-year-old record because no woman before Sai had accomplished this feat since the academy's establishment.

'AQI, AQI' chants greet Rekha Gupta at Messi event in smog-hit DelhiAmid Delhi's worsening air pollution, a section of spectators at the Arun Jaitley Stadium booed Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, chanting 'AQI, AQI' as she stepped on stage to welcome Argentine football icon Lionel Messi.

Smelly Indians remark gets US techie the boot, sparks fresh anti-India trollingNik Pash, AI head at Cline, was fired after his racist comment on a hackathon photo sparked outrage on social media. But his sacking triggered a chain reaction of debates over what many called mob justice and overreaction to a 'harmless' comment.

Bondi Beach gunman seen trembling, collapsing on bridge in new aerial footageA tragic shooting at Bondi Beach during a Jewish holiday has left many dead and injured, with dramatic drone footage revealing the chaos as police intervened. The incident has shaken Sydney, prompting heightened security and ongoing investigations.

Dhurandhar vs Animal: Gore, machismo and two polarising blockbustersWhat connects Dhurandhar and Animal beyond their violence and box office numbers? Here's an exploration of why audiences can't stop talking about them, even when they disagree.

How IndiGo crisis reveals a bigger tragedy: Air India not seen as ready solutionWhile lakhs of Indians suffered due to the IndiGo fiasco, not many thought of Air India as the Maharaja in a shining armour that could come to their rescue. Air India, which sucked in much-loved Vistara, is trying to find its feet with a refurbished fleet. But decades of bad memories aren't overwritten overnight. Air India can use this moment to step up and reclaim lost ground.

He grabbed my hand: Woman molested by Rapido rider, robbed of Rs 1,000A 19-year-old Rapido bike taxi rider in Maharashtra's Kalyan was arrested for allegedly molesting a 26-year-old woman and stealing Rs 1,000 from her during a booked ride.

Rob Reiner had Trump Derangement Syndrome, died due to...: US President's shockerEven as Hollywood poured its heart out for Reiner, who appeared in the Leonardo DiCaprio-starrer 'The Wolf of Wall Street' and was best known for directing the all-time romantic classic 'When Harry Met Sally,' Trump stooped to a new low by calling one of his staunchest critics "tortured and struggling" a day after his death.

Died shielding wife: Man who survived Hitler's Holocaust killed by Bondi terroristsAfter surviving the horrors of Adolf Hitler's Holocaust and rebuilding his life in Australia, 87-year-old Alex Kleytman was killed in the terrorist attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach. Kleytman, who was at the beach celebrating Hanukkah with his family, died while protecting his wife as the terrorists opened fire at the Jewish gathering.

Represents best of our country: Australian PM visits Bondi hero at hospitalAhmed, a Syrian-born shopkeeper, leapt onto one of the shooters during the massacre, which left 15 dead, and wrestled the gun from his hands. He has now explained what went through his head during the encounter.

H-1B, H-4 visas prudentially revoked in US amid interview delays in IndiaAmid the mass rescheduling of H-1B visa interviews in India, many US-based temporary work visa holders have reportedly received emails informing them that their visas have been "prudentially revoked". An immigration expert says many previously cleared issues are being re-reviewed.

4 cities, 1 GOAT: Lionel Messi's India tour that had it allLionel Messi's India tour moved through chaos and calm, heartbreak and joy. Across four cities, fans waited, erred, celebrated and found fleeting magic in the presence of football's greatest.

India Today @ 50 Part 1: Revisiting India's most turbulent decadeIndia Today Group marks its 50th anniversary with a five-part docu-series reflecting on its impactful journey in Indian journalism. The series revisits pivotal moments from 1975 to 1985, highlighting political and cultural shifts that shaped the nation.

Trump sues BBC for $10 billion over edited broadcast of 2021 Capitol speechThe lawsuit includes one count of defamation and another under Florida's Deceptive and Unfair Trade Practices Act, seeking $5 billion in damages for each claim.

Could be dead: Suu Kyi's son says he hasn't heard from jailed ex-leader in yearsKim Aris told Reuters he has not heard from his 80-year-old mother in years, and has received only sporadic, secondhand details about her heart, bone and gum problems since a 2021 military coup that deposed her government.

Watch: Ukraine hits Russian submarine with underwater drones for the first timeUkrainian officials said the strike hit a key Russian naval asset at Novorossiysk, dealing a major blow to Moscow's Black Sea Fleet and complicating efforts to repair or replace the vessel.

sports.headline: IPL 2026 auction live: Cameron Green, uncapped Indians set for big payday IPL Auction 2026 live updates: The Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026) mini auction is all set to get underway from 2:30 pm in Abu Dhabi. A total of 359 players will go under the hammer with 77 available slots to fill across ten teams.

Ruben Amorim backs Manchester United defenders after 4-4 letdown vs Bournemouth Ruben Amorim defended Manchester United's backline after a chaotic 4-4 draw against Bournemouth. Despite conceding four goals, the United head coach insisted his defenders have quality and only need better collective defending.

IPL 2026 auction has a new rule and it's stirring a debate IPL Auction: The Indian Premier League mini-auction is set to take place in Abu Dhabi. Ahead of the event, a major rule change has sparked widespread debate among fans, with many questioning whether the new regulation makes any sense at all.

Shubman Gill should play the Virat Kohli role in T20Is: Former wicketkeeper Deep Dasgupta has urged India's T20I vice-captain Shubman Gill to emulate Virat Kohli's anchoring role in the shortest format. Gill hasn't been in great form since his return to T20Is, having scored just 291 runs in 15 innings.

Why did Jasprit Bumrah leave IND vs SA series midway? Jasprit Bumrah left the India vs South Africa T20I series midway for personal reasons. The Indian pacer reportedly returned to Mumbai after a close family member was hospitalised, with his comeback depending on recovery.

IPL mini-auction complete guide: Where to watch, FAQs and top players The Indian Premier League auction is set to take place in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday, 15 December. In case you have missed the build-up, don't worry, we have you covered. Check out our article to know which team has the most purse, who will be the top picks, and where can you watch the event live.

Watch: Messi lands in Jamnagar to visit Anant Ambani's Vantara wildlife rescue Lionel Messi extended his India visit with a planned trip to Jamnagar. The Argentine icon will visit Anant Ambani's Vantara wildlife rescue centre after concluding the G.O.A.T. India Tour 2025 in New Delhi.

Gap between SA and NZ series? Play Vijay Hazare, BCCI tells India stars The BCCI has made it compulsory for all senior national players to participate in at least two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches. This move aims to ensure players do not treat domestic cricket as second-class tournaments.

IPL 2026 to begin on March 26, final scheduled for May 31: Report The 2026 edition of the Indian Premier League is likely to begin on March 26, with the final scheduled for May 31. Whether the opening match of the tournament will be played at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium is still under review.

4 cities, 1 GOAT: Lionel Messi's India tour that had it all Lionel Messi's India tour moved through chaos and calm, heartbreak and joy. Across four cities, fans waited, erred, celebrated and found fleeting magic in the presence of football's greatest.

A hobbling body, heart left full: Sunil Chhetri reflects on his Messi moment at Mumbai Sunil Chhetri opens up on meeting Lionel Messi during the Mumbai leg of the GOAT India Tour, revealing how the fan in him won amid injury struggles.

Lionel Messi's parting words to India: I will return, hopefully to play a matchLegendary Lionel Messi's tour of India concluded in New Delhi on Monday, December 15. Messi addressed the audience at the Arun Jaitley Stadium and shared a message of love to the fans.

Axar Patel ruled out of remaining IND vs SA T20Is due to illnessIndia all-rounder Axar Patel has been ruled out of the remaining two T20I matches against South Africa due to illness. His absence comes at a crucial time as India finalises the squad for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

Anant Ambani to host Lionel Messi and co at Vantara after Delhi trip: ReportLionel Messi is reportedly set for a one-night stop at Vantara, the wildlife rescue centre in Jamnagar, where Anant Ambani will host the football star as part of the GOAT India Tour.

Tim Seifert warms up for IPL 2026 auction with 53-ball century in BBLTim Seifert warmed up for the IPL 2026 auction in style by smashing a 56-ball century for Melbourne Renegades against Brisbane Heat, powering a 14-run BBL win and earning Player of the Match honours.

Messi's GOAT Tour: Meets Minerva academy, Jay Shah gifts World Cup ticket in DelhiLionel Messi's GOAT tour in India: Lionel Messi's final stop of the GOAT tour in Delhi was short but electric, with roaring crowds, smiling youngsters and a heartfelt goodbye that brought the GOAT India Tour to a memorable close.

Jay Shah gifts Lionel Messi India vs USA T20 World Cup 2026 ticket in New DelhiJay Shah gifted Lionel Messi a ticket for the India vs USA match at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 during a special New Delhi interaction, highlighting a symbolic crossover between global football and Indian cricket.

Shaheen Afridi makes horror BBL debut, removed from attack for dangerous bowlingShaheen Shah Afridi suffered a nightmare BBL debut, being taken off for dangerous bowling during the Brisbane Heat vs Melbourne Renegades clash on Monday at Simonds Stadium in Geelong.

Messi in India: Abhinav Bindra questions focus on individuals over sports cultureOlympic champion Abhinav Bindra has shared thoughtful reflections on Lionel Messi's GOAT India Tour, questioning the spectacle around fleeting access to icons and urging greater investment in grassroots sport across the country.

Arshdeep Singh creates pressure from other end, like bowling with him: HarshitIndia's seam-bowling all-rounder Harshit Rana said he relishes sharing the new ball with Arshdeep Singh, crediting the left-arm pacer for consistently building pressure from the opposite end.

Simon Harmer named ICC Men's Player of the Month after incredible India Test tourSouth Africa's off-spinner Simon Harmer was named ICC Men's Player of the Month for November after a dominant Test series against India, taking 17 wickets at an average of 8.94 and earning Player of the Series honours.

With the Ashes on the line, England's Harry Brook accepts he must curb aggressionThe Ashes 2025-26: Speaking ahead of the third Test in Adelaide, England's Harry Brook admitted that his shot-selection in his first tour Down Under have not been ideal and said that he has to cut down on his aggression while batting.

Shafali Verma named ICC Women's Player of the Month after World Cup heistShafali Verma was named ICC Women's Player of the Month for November 2025 after a match-winning all-round performance in India's World Cup final triumph over South Africa.

Keep this shot in cold storage: Sunil Gavaskar's blunt advice to SuryakumarFormer India captain Sunil Gavaskar was blunt in his assessment, urging Suryakumar Yadav to put his pick-up shot in "cold storage" until he finds the right moment to bring it back.

PSL 2026 to start on March 26, confirms PCB chief, again set to clash with IPLThe PCB has confirmed that PSL 11 will run from March 26 to May 3, overlapping with the IPL, prompting schedule adjustments, a January 8 auction for two new franchises, and paving the way for an eight-team league in 2026.

Who is Deepesh Devendran? Dale Steyn fan wrecks Pakistan in U19 Asia CupDeepesh Devendran continued his rapid rise by ripping through Pakistan with 3/16 in the U19 Asia Cup clash on Sunday in Dubai, underlining his emergence as India's standout fast-bowling prospect.

Desperate England rope in 6'4" speedster for must-win Adelaide TestEngland recalled Josh Tongue for the must-win third Ashes Test in Adelaide, backing the in-form pacer while retaining Ollie Pope and Will Jacks as they look to end a long winless run in Australia.

PM Modi congratulates Indian squash team on historic maiden World Cup winPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Indian squash team for their historic maiden Squash World Cup title, saying that the title triumph has made the entire nation proud.

IPL 2026 auction: Six uncapped stars franchises could targetIPL 2026 auction: Uncapped stars to watch – explosive batters, versatile all-rounders and promising young bowlers who could become breakout sensations or bargain buys for franchises

Messi in India Highlights: Next stop Vantara after Delhi-leg of GOAT tourMessi in India, GOAT tour Day 3 Highlights: Lionel Messi has finally arrived at the Arun Jaitley stadium, and he met with the Minerva Academy's young stars for a quick photo-op.

New Zealand pacer Blair Tickner set to miss white-ball tour of IndiaBlair Tickner is likely to miss New Zealand's five-match ODI and three-match T20I series in India, beginning on January 11, after dislocating his shoulder during the second Test against the West Indies.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
